column1: .@WVNationalGuard has been such a valuable partner in West Virginia’s #coronavirus fight. Thank you! https://t.co/6AfRStvYnG
Lots of free #COVID19 testing going on around the state today. Get tested before Thanksgiving especially if you’re traveling! https://t.co/WQjvGCjJRS
Don’t bring an unwanted guest to Thanksgiving! Get your flu shot and get COVID tested before the holiday! https://t.co/Q4yHrqbKHY
Heading into the holiday season it’s more important than ever to wash your hands wear a mask and social distance. https://t.co/u8ytCp6lLF
In the season finale of this behind-the-scenes documentary we recap the partisan games Democrats played as Republicans tried to negotiate another #coronavirus package. https://t.co/Tyy2styAg7
In Episode Three go behind the scenes of our legislative response to the #coronavirus which included the CARES Act the largest economic relief package ever. https://t.co/AZUNh0IApU

As #coronavirus spread @realDonaldTrump took action with a travel ban. Learn more about the impact of that decision and what we learned about the virus during that time in Episode Two. ⬇️ https://t.co/V4CeOXzl9Z

Thrilled to see the administration fix the loophole @SenJackReed and I identified in our “Ensuring Access to COVID-19 Vaccines for Seniors Act” and ensure our seniors will have access to any authorized or approved COVID vaccine at no cost. https://t.co/OP11HTnmWT
Go behind the scenes of the Senate when we first learned about #coronavirus in this new documentary series. Episode One ⬇️ https://t.co/VSPfG3hfaY
.@FruthPharmacy is offering free drive-thru COVID tests at 21 locations. Register here to get your test: https://t.co/HGjUIR3uOl https://t.co/an9t9QYZG8
NEWS: I’m working with @SenJackReed to ensure seniors enrolled in Medicare can access free COVID-19 vaccines as soon as they’re available. Learn more: https://t.co/NolqX8Q2Ye

Speaker Pelosi has pretended to negotiate #coronavirus relief for months. She gets upset when the media calls her out for not compromising. Yesterday Senate Dems once again blocked a compromise bill that included relief for priorities Republicans and Democrats agree on. https://t.co/WKQ8yK2TUk

Given that COVID-19 has suppressed demand for gasoline diesel and jet fuel any increase in the mandate would cause severe and outsized economic harm next year by raising costs for consumers particularly at the gas pump. ⛽️
Lots of free #coronavirus testing happening around the state today. ⬇️ https://t.co/Kg4EZimcWU

This funding provides the required 75% cost share for COVID-19 tests given to #WV nursing home staff & residents from April through July of this year mandated by an executive order signed by @WVGovernor.
NEWS: @fema announced they’re providing #WV with more than $1.2 million for #coronavirus testing in West Virginia nursing homes.

Coplin Health Systems was recently awarded a #telehealth grant by the @FCC. Today I’m visiting River Valley Family Care to learn more about how they’re using telehealth to stay connected to the community during #coronavirus. https://t.co/xF0Ut2RirN

There’s areas of agreement for another coronavirus package: help for small businesses vaccine development schools and families. So let’s deliver targeted relief to help businesses and others who are still struggling. https://t.co/CWcow0EbtC

Good news: #WV is receiving $908926 from @HHSGov for #COVID19 vaccine preparedness. We must ensure that we have the infrastructural support for vaccine distribution so when the vaccine is ready we can quickly distribute it to those who need it the most.
Special thanks to @WVaChamber for inviting me to talk more about #broadband and expanding economic growth in our state. #Coronavirus has highlighted the digital divide in America.

Given my recent negative #coronavirus test result I asked @CDCDirector about the impact self-quarantining has had on the spread of the virus and if and when I should get tested again. His response: https://t.co/oJhqQHKBAA

As we’ve seen in Monongalia County universities can have a major impact on the #coronavirus spread in a community. Today I asked @HHS_ASH his recommendations when dealing with testing on college campuses: https://t.co/4bVHYCJAsS

Last week’s vote on a targeted #coronavirus relief package was really frustrating. We should be able to pass what we all agree on: money for schools PPE relief for small businesses & vaccine development. https://t.co/87OHIpg8e4
TUNE IN: I’ll be questioning @HHSGov and @CDCgov officials on the federal #coronavirus response. Watch live here at 10:00 a.m.: https://t.co/jeFlC4gZPy https://t.co/Gp60CJcB1O

UPDATE: The test came back NEGATIVE. Despite my negative coronavirus test result I will be following CDC recommendations & the advice of the Capitol Attending Physician & will be quarantining for 14 days as a precaution. Thank you for your prayers calls texts & kind comments. https://t.co/NxLGZgDsUn

I sent a letter to @DEAHQ requesting information about how the DEA’s work to combat the opioid epidemic has been impacted by COVID-19 and how the agency has adjusted operations to address this challenge. More details: https://t.co/zm6o13yKys https://t.co/Zt9XCS7QEv

Glad #WV was approved for more than $13 million to support workers who have lost wages due to COVID-19. This @fema funding will allow #WV to provide those unemployed with $300/week on top of their regular unemployment benefit.
.@WVNationalGuard has been an invaluable asset in our state’s fight against #coronavirus. Thank you for always answering the call! https://t.co/hYlKgs4h8u

I’ve been in touch daily with West Virginians that still need help due to the challenges presented by #coronavirus. We had an opportunity to really deliver on this help today. Unfortunately the Senate failed.

This week the Senate is voting on another #coronavirus relief bill. This is a targeted approach to help schools #smallbiz and to enhance testing and vaccine development. Here’s why I’m voting yes: https://t.co/HilJ4rLjW6

GOOD NEWS: The latest round of @fema funding will allow @workforcewv to continue to provide an additional $300/week of unemployment due to #coronavirus. This comes after @WVGovernor directed WorkForce to apply for this funding.
Special thanks to Lincoln EMS Director Trish Watson for speaking with me today about how #coronavirus has affected their service. https://t.co/1eOAn1bkk1

The research @WVUMedicine is conducting into #coronavirus is simply incredible. I’m so impressed with the work @DoctorAliRezai and his team are doing – using artificial intelligence to help predict the onset and prevent the spread of #COVID19. https://t.co/UgulWl2sDa

I’m up in the Northern Panhandle today visiting with Wellsburg mayor Sue Simonetti to hear more about the impact of #COVID-19 on local governments and needed infrastructure projects in the area. https://t.co/55z9brIua5

BIG NEWS: West Virginia will be receiving more than $43 million to help combat the #opioid epidemic. #Coronavirus has been understandably first in people’s minds but we’re still fighting the opioid battle.

Thank you to @realDonaldTrump for taking action to help support workers who have lost wages due to COVID-19. As Chair of  Homeland Security Approps. subcmte. I have & will continue to monitor the resources within the Disaster Relief Fund especially at critical times like this.

This is welcomed news. Sadly domestic violence incidents have increased during #coronavirus. This funding will help victim service providers and law enforcement respond to violence against women. https://t.co/23UoewjW2P

📱 Another telephone townhall in the books! A special thank you to @claymarsh for joining me to answer questions about #coronavirus getting our kids back to school broadband economic development and more. https://t.co/3gQ27PS6js
Loved talking with Chris Parsley of Charleston Blueprint today. Chris received a #PPP loan to help his small business weather #coronavirus. Another #PPP success story in #WV. https://t.co/HqMruB1Kla
HAPPENING SOON: Joining @WVGovernor for his virtual COVID-19 briefing. Here’s where to watch live ⬇️ https://t.co/FCwDny2OBp

Many children get nutritious meals from school. Given COVID-19 adjustments I joined my colleagues in sending a letter to @SecretarySonny to urge @USDA to continue providing flexibility to schools for school meals & child nutrition. Details: https://t.co/eohlrRDtAT https://t.co/cRlazrOxcd

Great to have @VP in West Virginia today. We met w/ @WVGovernor members of @realDonaldTrump’s COVID-19 Task Force & others to discuss relief efforts & the importance of getting back to the negotiating table to find common ground so we can deliver needed relief for Americans. https://t.co/RZmES5D8sp
COVID-19 is taking a toll on our mental health and/or substance abuse issues. Help is available. Learn more ⬇️ https://t.co/1SKbFYlEdK

The @uscapitol is closed to visitors because of COVID-19 but you can join my interns on a virtual tour of the Capitol and learn more about its rich history. We hope to see you back in D.C. soon! https://t.co/Khh03UfFOY
Click here to see where you can receive FREE COVID-19 testing in your county: https://t.co/YxQs0LkSRB

Read my letter to @realDonaldTrump requesting the federal government continue to cover 100% of the cost share for the @WVNationalGuard’s response to the coronavirus pandemic under Title 32 orders. More details: https://t.co/6tPteKqkXL https://t.co/DXjzSjdAoH

I truly don’t think there is a state that has utilized its National Guard more broadly in response to this pandemic than #WV. The @WVNationalGuard plays a tremendous role in our fight against the coronavirus and we should continue to support their efforts.

I’m joining my colleagues @SenToomey and @SenatorBennet in the #WearAMask challenge. #WearAMask wash your hands frequently and maintain physical distance to help stop the spread of COVID-19. I challenge @SenJohnBarrasso and @SenatorShaheen to participate as well! 😷 https://t.co/aPBkOHu8pN https://t.co/s7Nq2syl0N
Sadly opioid overdoses have skyrocketed during #coronavirus. We can’t let up on our fight against opioids. https://t.co/laU4Bus6IT
I talked with @arishapiro about the next COVID relief package. Listen here: https://t.co/gdhvbWrUfH

Honored to receive the 2020 Champion for Healthy Seniors award from @pfcd this morning. West Virginia has an older population and taking care of our seniors is especially important right now as we continue to fight #coronavirus. https://t.co/MHvV8Xqs6B
Earlier today I spoke on the Senate floor about how the COVID-19 pandemic has exasperated the addiction crisis. My full remarks: https://t.co/OEfbkA9nL4

ICYMI: On Friday I met with @ONDCP Director Jim Carroll to talk about how #coronavirus has sadly exasperated the drug epidemic across the country and in West Virginia. @WSAZirr has the story: https://t.co/qbSZ6Kx5M7
ICYMI: I joined @BloombergTV to discuss negotiations on the next round of COVID-19 relief and how it will affect West Virginia. Our full conversation: https://t.co/QEc2kr163O

West Virginia is a state rich with history and culture. A great example of this is in Matewan at @WarsWv which received CARES funding to help them digitize their collection and resume operations during the COVID-19 pandemic. Check out their exhibits here: https://t.co/zq80S4l6Nq

#Telehealth is so important especially during the COVID-19 pandemic and it will continue to be important into the future. This week I was proud to introduce a bill to study the impacts of telehealth during COVID-19. Learn more: https://t.co/7OdL6cnLSI

Just spoke w/ @CDCDirector Dr. Redfield about ways to limit the spread of COVID-19 and pledged to work together to reverse the rise in drug overdose deaths during the pandemic. I encourage WVians to wear a mask and to follow guidelines set by the @CDCgov & @WVGovernor. #WVStrong

Great telephone townhall with Mon. and Preston counties tonight. Thanks for your thoughtful questions on masks testing and the next coronavirus relief package. I value the chance to hear directly from fellow West Virginians while here in Washington. https://t.co/eCJRkapkyU
TUNE IN: Today in a @SenateCommerce subcommittee hearing we’re discussing how to protect Americans from COVID-19 scams. Watch live here at 2:30 p.m.: https://t.co/VS6iSuSB7u https://t.co/Q05GQe6Pn7
Learn more about how a small business in Hampshire County adapted to COVID-19: https://t.co/prxNgspZHH
NEWS: Beckley ARH Hospital is receiving more than $9 million in COVID-19 relief funding. More details: https://t.co/eixclU0x6K

GREAT NEWS: @HHSgov just announced they’re granting another $3 billion for safety-net hospitals. Our hospitals have gone above and beyond during the #coronavirus pandemic and this additional funding will certainly be a big help!

Sadly opioid overdoses have skyrocketed during #coronavirus. The socialization aspect of recovery is so important. @NIH has been working to figure out the best way to provide support for these individuals during this time. I asked @NIHDirector about this: https://t.co/3RVv76r7Wb

One of the biggest takeaways from #coronavirus is that we really need to reassess our medical supply chain. Today I asked @BARDA Acting Director Dr. Gary Disbrow if we’re making sure that a #coronavirus vaccine is being developed with materials made in the U.S.: https://t.co/BaSQ3VrI0G

The benefits of the Hub have been made even clearer by disruptions of supply chains — particularly those rooted in China — during the COVID-19 crisis. Our economic security requires we be able to manufacture PPE and other products here in the U.S.

#Smallbiz in WV has taken a hit during this pandemic. For businesses that were already in the process of recovering from other setbacks prior to COVID-19 this only added to their burdens. https://t.co/wkD8q4rVUL
Wearing a mask is still important to prevent the spread of #coronavirus. Please wear a mask in public and protect those around you! 😷 https://t.co/Mkg3SKZsN9

NEWS: @FCC is awarding West Virginia United Health Systems a #telehealth grant! Bringing quality reliable care to West Virginians right at home is the future of accessible health services especially during the COVID-19 pandemic.  #CapitoConnect
ICYMI: Earlier this week I wrote an op-ed highlighting several West Virginians who have made a difference in their communities during #coronavirus. https://t.co/Ui82wMksaf

Throughout the #coronavirus pandemic we’ve seen so many people from all across this country stepping up in major ways especially here in West Virginia. Read more about some of the unsung heroes in our state: https://t.co/Mmp6OthRAK
#CARESAct funding is helping our state’s most vulnerable citizens during #coronavirus ⬇️ https://t.co/hRFANVe6c0

Paramedics at Kanawha Co. Emergency Ambulance Authority are some of our most essential front line workers. These men & women risk their own health transporting suspected COVID-19 patients to hospitals. I wanted to stop by & thank them for what they’ve been doing. It’s tough work. https://t.co/3jrzUSmen3

Stopped by @KCHealth1 today to learn more about the local response to #coronavirus & say thank you to the professionals who have been working around the clock. From the call center operators to the public health drs all hands have been on deck and our community is grateful. https://t.co/OA8A5zDH8W
Learn more about the CEASE Act my bipartisan bill to crack down on scammers during coronavirus: https://t.co/WVQJAtrxe4

NEWS: I joined my colleagues @SenCoryGardner and @SenatorSinema to introduce the CEASE Act which proposes harsher fines and punishment for individuals who use the #COVID-19 pandemic to prey on people with scams and fraud. More info: https://t.co/53U5fsYcS2 https://t.co/51FyJy0CAk
Times are tough but these West Virginia small businesses are getting creative and helping their communities during #coronavirus. https://t.co/diD239lCIJ

Thanks to @realdonaldtrump for your continued support during COVID-19 by approving additional Individual Assistance funds for the Crisis Counseling Program for all areas in the state of West Virginia.
Great news! I sent a letter to @POTUS last week about this very issue. @WVNationalGuard is a tremendous asset in our fight against #coronavirus. https://t.co/OONSy8OgDR

Another example of the incredible work coming out of @WVUMedicine. @DoctorAliRezai and team are working to identify #COVID infected individuals before symptoms present themselves. #WestVirginiaProud https://t.co/q95bPqAt8j
ICYMI: Learn more about why Speaker Pelosi’s $3 trillion #coronavirus package will never become law in my op-ed: https://t.co/ILHuHJ8Z7v
Speaker Pelosi's legislation will not become law as she already knows. But we will continue to press forward to respond as one nation to #coronavirus. More in my new op-ed: https://t.co/eL9D1wQdJt

NEWS: #WV is receiving more than $31 million for nursing homes impacted by #coronavirus. Our seniors in these assisted living facilities are especially vulnerable and this will help protect them and those working to keep them healthy. https://t.co/1zPLDKZLff https://t.co/zL4XDLXjKM

I sent a letter to @realDonaldTrump @DeptofDefense Sec. Esper & @FEMA_Pete asking them to provide improved status leave healthcare & reimbursement benefits to National Guard service members who are providing invaluable support during #COVID19. More: https://t.co/IcBDF5CJtJ https://t.co/A648ln37a2
My bill the Coronavirus Relief Fund Flexibility Act allows states and local governments to use #CARESAct funding to address revenue losses directly attributable to #coronavirus.
ICYMI: West Virginia rural health clinics are receiving more than $2 million to expand #coronavirus testing. More details: https://t.co/Dp21QvtZZz

NEWS: @FCC just announced they approved Lincoln County Primary Care Center for $967304 in support of #telehealth services for #WV during #coronavirus. This is the second application for COVID-19 telehealth services FCC has approved for WV. More details: https://t.co/ROE5A1A8fK https://t.co/UUIL2HaseF

Today I outlined why Speaker Pelosi’s bill is not a serious #coronavirus response. Right now the Senate is evaluating additional aid & providing oversight on the trillions we’ve already spent. Together we will get through this but our response must be bipartisan & unified. https://t.co/LiwBdzW4ay

“Congress is considering several bills to accomplish that. One co-sponsored by WV Republican Senator Shelley Moore Capito has gained bi-partisan support. Capito and Senators from several small population states have signed on to the Coronavirus Relief Fund Flexibility Act.” https://t.co/ZIo4mvgIPa

.@SecondLady is right. May is #MentalHealthMonth and #coronavirus has a lot of people feeling lonely and anxious. You don’t have to suffer alone. Help is available with @Help4WV. Call 1-844-HELP-4WV. #MentalHealthMatters https://t.co/rg2MnWDCss

.@CAMCHealth nurse Kristin Schneider quarantines herself from her family because she is taking care of #coronavirus patients. Medical professionals across the state are sacrificing time and togetherness with their families to take care of others. We are so grateful. Thank you. https://t.co/1h2JfHEdtP
Today I’m announcing funding that will go to #WV to provide temporary housing assistance and supportive services to victims of family domestic & dating violence in response to #coronavirus.
I’ve heard from advocacy organizations and experts who are concerned about the impact of the #coronavirus on domestic violence.

GOOD NEWS: West Virginia is receiving more than $57 million to increase #coronavirus testing. As our state begins to open up tests must be readily available. Learn more: https://t.co/EqqfivC1Gx https://t.co/X9jvZntgbq

Today on the Senate floor I paid tribute to several West Virginians across the state who have stepped up to help their community in this time of need. They exemplify the “West Virginia spirit." Here are a few examples of people making a difference during #coronavirus: https://t.co/QSxn3Kn37B

I’m co-sponsoring the Safeguarding America’s First Responders Act (SAFR) legislation that clarifies the certification requirements for survivor benefits under the Public Safety Officers Benefits Program to account for the unique challenges presented by #coronavirus.

WATCH: I’ll be on the Senate floor around 2:20 p.m. talking about West Virginians who have made a difference in their communities during #coronavirus. Tune in here: https://t.co/myMjNQX7Gu https://t.co/x69qbthTu2

NEWS: #WV is receiving more than $1M from @fema to strengthen our emergency management services improve our state’s COVID-19 related data collection and provide our communities with the resources and strategy necessary to keep our residents safe. More: https://t.co/TWbiRB3bTQ https://t.co/dqMwNmvyal

The Coronavirus Relief Fund Flexibility Act would allow states to use #CARESAct money to address revenue losses to prevent cuts to essential services. It will NOT allow states to use their funds for whatever they want—like pensions. Losses must be directly related to COVID-19. https://t.co/vwvoGan2oT

HAPPENING NOW: Join me in today’s @SenateCommerce  hearing where I’ll be talking more about how #coronavirus has underscored the #broadband disparities in rural America. Watch here: https://t.co/jc5a2lXvts #CapitoConnect

Check out https://t.co/AGCSHr1tac for the latest updates on the federal #coronavirus response and a list of resources including testing locations info on economic impact payments and more. https://t.co/ZZomb1826P
NEWS: West Virginia is receiving more than $9.8 million to expand #coronavirus testing in health centers across #WV! Details: https://t.co/QE9Be1ORPY https://t.co/r8FOJl4Uo3

Last night I introduced a bipartisan bill with @SenDanSullivan and others from smaller states like #WV that would modify the #CARESAct to allow state and local governments to use relief fund dollars to replace lost revenues attributable to COVID-19. https://t.co/JnFcgWaxkX

West Virginians have really pulled together during #coronavirus. Is there someone making a difference in your community? A person or a group really going above and beyond right now? Let me know: https://t.co/Ac8p1kDWp7
Glad to see the brave men and women at #HSI are continuing to investigate #coronavirus scams. https://t.co/iaOZzQPSkr

Nurses across the country and in West Virginia have gone above and beyond during #coronavirus. Today I want to give a special thank you to them for all the love and care they give patients day in and day out. #NationalNursesDay #ThankYouNurses https://t.co/913GzqMYFU

We’ve provided significant coronavirus relief so far & it’s important we assess the impact so we can see where more help may be needed. Continuing to throw money at a problem will not solve it. Now we need to take a minute to evaluate what’s working what’s not & go from there. https://t.co/0oVQRZILDR

...hearing for the special inspector general for pandemic recovery (oversight of coronavirus legislation) confirmation hearing for @realDonaldTrump’s nominee to be @ODNIgov and more. There’s a lot to do and the American people expect us to do our jobs.

What’s going on in the Senate this week?                   @SenateCommerce is holding a hearing on the impact of #coronavirus on the aviation industry marking up the 2020 water infrastructure bills in @EPWGOP committee... https://t.co/3QkMyj0iLr

It’s #TeacherAppreciationWeek. West Virginia teachers have really stepped up to the plate during #coronavirus making sure students aren’t falling behind on their studies. Take time today to #ThankATeacher. 🍎 https://t.co/P8YyKyv9bA
Read my column for @AARPWV about how I’m working to make sure West Virginia is equipped to fight COVID-19 head on ⬇️ https://t.co/5jgGzqKDxc

Dozens of higher education institutions in West Virginia are receiving funding thanks to the #CARESAct. The faculty staff and students of our colleges and universities have faced unprecedented challenges in the face of COVID-19.

Had a good phone call with @SecWilkie this morning. I appreciate his willingness to work with @Sen_JoeManchin and me to allow mobile testing sites to be covered in the same manner as urgent and emergency care services so veterans can get tested for #coronavirus at mobile sites.

#Coronavirus has highlighted the need for #telehealth but because many West Virginians do not have access to reliable broadband it can be impossible to use video-sharing to receive telehealth services during the COVID-19 pandemic.
One of the biggest lessons from #coronavirus? We’ve got to fix our medical supply chain. We should be manufacturing swabs gloves etc. right here in the U.S. https://t.co/Uc6XgjSgYb

ICYMI: West Virginia hospitals have another round of #coronavirus funding heading their way thanks to the #CARESAct. This is only the first half of the second round of funding so even more is on the way! Learn more: https://t.co/xcvUsC5rss https://t.co/FrMWsbfDm4
Read the letter @Sen_JoeManchin and I sent @SecWilkie asking that @DeptVetAffairs cover #coronavirus mobile testing sites in the same manner as urgent emergency care. https://t.co/4mkCHO5Bkp
The incredible folks at #HSI continue to work to combat COVID-19 related fraud and other criminal activity. Thank you for what you do! https://t.co/fiZMp7jd2j
.@WVNationalGuard is always ready no matter the mission. Thank you for all you’ve done during #coronavirus for our state. https://t.co/uA8P4CjicT

Many West Virginians have been working around the clock during the coronavirus pandemic. Among them are our WV coal miners. Thanks to our miners who continue working to power our country even during this national crisis. We should continue working to keep them safe on the job. https://t.co/DbFHEISTEc
Get the latest #coronavirus updates with my weekly newsletter: https://t.co/aZYwwOHyJE https://t.co/gbgDL0PaDo

#Coronavirus is affecting everyone differently. Veterans seeking mental health services please know you can call your local VAMC and request an appointment. Same-day services are being offered in some cases and #telehealth appointments are regularly being scheduled.
Listen to my interview with @juliemason on @POTUSPressPool – talking all things #coronavirus in West Virginia and how our state is working to fight back! https://t.co/9sDPZc1hgD
ICYMI: Check out my op-ed with @BrendanCarrFCC about why #telehealth is so important during #coronavirus: https://t.co/uJgw9f8D3j

During #coronavirus I’m making sure our health centers have the funding they need. Learn more about the more than $22 million going out to health centers across the state: https://t.co/6dAxAHeCdv https://t.co/MidOjKx2b3
Although we may be socially distant from each other we are never distant from His love and mercy. Charlie and I wish you a very blessed and healthy Easter. https://t.co/1k2gblDrLR
This Easter West Virginians will be celebrating a little differently. Coronavirus has sadly stolen away the joys of egg hunts and church fellowship.
Earlier this week I spoke @amandamanganarc about the #CARESAct telehealth and staying connected with your community during #coronavirus. Listen to our conversation here: https://t.co/SX62oVzp2z
Got 5? Read through my newsletter for the latest info on #coronavirus: https://t.co/nrt5UjyYUq

Thanks @SeemaCMS for briefing me on actions @CMSGov is taking to help rural health care providers. These providers are on the frontlines helping communities especially as we battle #coronavirus. I look forward to continuing work w/ you to ensure they have resources they need.

With many procedures put on hold rural hospitals are losing $ on top of #coronavirus stress. Read my letter to Senate leadership asking for clarity on eligibility for publicly-owned hospitals & similar care providers within the #PPPloan. Learn more here: https://t.co/n92ZOosDc6 https://t.co/yxlRhed9R6

Our new normal consists of doing day-to-day things at a distance—whether it’s teleworking distance learning virtual health appointments and more. #Coronavirus has made our state’s need for better connectivity even more clear. #CapitoConnect

GOOD NEWS: @realDonaldTrump just approved @WVGovernor's request for additional federal assistance for West Virginia to meet #coronavirus challenges. Earlier this week I sent a letter to the president supporting this request. https://t.co/YUpOrrgNWn

For non-COVID patients this is a great way to stay connected with doctors without risking your health by showing up at a health center full of individuals who have potentially been infected with COVID-19. #CapitoConnect

Expanding #telehealth now helps to not only limit the spread (people checking in with doctor via telehealth before showing up to a health center) but it also keeps our health centers clear so health officials can focus on #COVID19 patients. #CapitoConnect https://t.co/JaPkKrnbu1
Happy birthday Charlie! No one I’d rather social distance with. Hoping we can hang out with all our grandkids (including little Charlie) in a couple weeks! ❤️🥳 https://t.co/l0FZlUp6lY

NEWS: $19 million is heading to WV communities & the funding provides flexibility so cities can decide how support relief is best distributed during #coronavirus challenges. I was a staunch advocate for this provision during our CARES Act negotiations. https://t.co/qyGhsPLytQ https://t.co/CxR5UyHLku

Glad I could talk with constituents in the Northern Panhandle tonight and answer their questions about the #coronavirus relief package. As a Marshall County native it was great catching up with people from my neck of the woods. Thanks for participating! https://t.co/XCwEWm98AE
.@MUSOMWV is helping improve #coronavirus testing capabilities. #WestVirginiaProud https://t.co/jdDai56RHF

The entire West Virginia delegation has sent a letter to @realDonaldTrump in support of @WVGovernor's request for an expedited major disaster declaration for West Virginia as a result of the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. Read it here: https://t.co/aYD0f0osRe https://t.co/nhuIklNEqO

ATTENTION SMALL BUSINESSES: @SBA_WV is holding training workshops for small businesses looking to learn more about how to apply for a loan because of #coronavirus losses. Please look into one of these trainings and get the help you need! Check it out here: https://t.co/Pp0mG6xN1L
